revised_title: Anniversary Meeting: Celebrating Scientific Achievements and Remembering Fellows
tldr: The Royal Society held its Anniversary Meeting on November 30, 1891, to celebrate the achievements of its fellows and remember those who passed away. The meeting highlighted various scientific disciplines, including geology, astronomy, mathematics, engineering, and biology. Notable fellows who passed away were James Croll, John Marshall, Dr. Casey, Dr. Brady, Dr. Graham Balfour, Dr. Peter Martin Duncan, Sir John Hawkshaw, Sir Prescott Gardner Hewett, and Dr. Philip Herbert Carpenter.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science and Technology
